page.title: 11ADULT CLUBS IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: The Womens Institute,founded in 1937, has met continuously on every second Tuesday of the month in the village hall.The meetings usually have a speaker except in August (the annual outing) and November (the birthday party).Membership of 22 women. The Forget-me-not club,founded in 1960 for senior citizens,provides social evenings in the village hall on alternate Wednesdays.Speakers,films, outings and parties are much enjoyed. Membership of 30 people. The Sports and Social club has a clubhouse on the recreation ground.It has a thriving sports section for cricket and bowls.The licensed bar is much appreciated,as we no longer have a village pub. There is also a Mothers Union and a branch of the Oddfellows Friendly society.
